case_vignette: A 4-YEAR-OLD BOY IS BROUGHT TO THE PHYSICIAN BY HIS PARENTS BECAUSE OF CONCERNS ABOUT HIS BEHAVIOR DURING THE PAST YEAR. HIS PARENTS REPORT THAT HE OFTEN FAILS TO ANSWER WHEN THEY CALL HIM AND HAS REGULAR UNPROVOKED EPISODES OF CRYING AND SCREAMING. AT KINDERGARTEN, HE CAN FOLLOW AND PARTICIPATE IN GROUP ACTIVITIES, BUT DOES NOT FOLLOW HIS TEACHER'S INSTRUCTIONS WHEN THESE ARE GIVEN TO HIM DIRECTLY. HE IS OTHERWISE CHEERFUL AND MAINTAINS EYE CONTACT WHEN SPOKEN TO BUT DOES NOT RESPOND WHEN ENGAGED IN PLAY. HE GETS ALONG WELL WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY. HE STARTED WALKING AT THE AGE OF 11 MONTHS AND CAN SPEAK IN TWO-TO-THREE-WORD PHRASES. HE OFTEN MISPRONOUNCES WORDS.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I often fail to answer when called, have unprovoked episodes of crying and screaming, and do not follow direct instructions even though I can participate in group activities.
How old are you?
I am 4 years old.

Yes, I often mispronounce words.
Have you had any hearing tests done? If so, what were the results?
I haven't mentioned undergoing any hearing tests or their results.
Does anyone in your family have a history of hearing problems or developmental delays?
I haven't mentioned any family history of hearing problems or developmental delays.
Final Diagnosis: Hearing Impairment
